availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Thomas Vallandingham. Father of Charles T. Vallandingham, Joseph Vallandingham, Richard Vallandingham, William Vallandingham, and George Vallandingham. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 262B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, City/District, p. 120.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 52-53.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994027, Ballard County Births.
